revised_title: The Dual Influence of Nitrogen Peroxide on Two-Stage Ignition of Hydrocarbons
tldr: This study investigates the influence of nitrogen peroxide on the two-stage ignition of hydrocarbons, such as propane, n-butane, and acetaldehyde. The results show that nitrogen peroxide has a dual effect on the ignition process, inhibiting the reactions leading to cool flames and promoting direct oxidation. Large amounts of nitrogen peroxide can also exhibit an anti-catalytic influence, possibly due to self-neutralization of active centers.
